sen.j: 押媛（おしひめ）は、欠史八代、孝安天皇の皇后。
sen.e: Oshihime was the Empress of Emperor Koan, one of the eight emperors reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
sen.cmt: 欠史八代→定訳不明：Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns)としました。
sen.e: Oshihime was the Empress of Emperor Koan, one of the eight emperors who reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
Oshihime was the Empress of Emperor Koan, one of the eight emperors who reigned during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).

sen.j: 孝霊天皇と大吉備諸進命の生母。
sen.e: She was the real mother of Emperor Korei and Okibinomorosusumi no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 大吉備諸進命→Okibinomorosusumi no mikotoとしました。
sen.e: She was the real mother of Emperor Korei and Okibinomorosusumi no mikoto.
She was the real mother of Emperor Korei and Okibinomorosusumi no mikoto.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』本文の皇后で天足彦國押人の娘かつ孝安天皇の姪である。
sen.e: She was the Empress who appears in the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and she was the daughter of Amatarashihikokunioshihito as well as the niece of Emperor Koan.
sen.cmt: 天足彦國押人→Amatarashihikokunioshihito としました。
sen.e: She was the Empress, who appears in the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and she was a daughter of Amatarashihikokunioshihito as well as a niece of Emperor Koan.
sen.cmt: whoの前にカンマを挿入。冠詞の見直し。
sen.e: She was the Empress, who appears in the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and she was a daughter of Amatarashihikokunioshihito as well as a niece of Emperor Koan.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』第1の一書での皇后は磯城県主葉江の娘である長媛、第2の一書での皇后は十市県主五十坂彦の娘である五十坂媛。
sen.e: In the 'alternate writing 1-1' transmitted by the Nihonshoki, the Empress is called Nagahime, who was the daughter of Shiki no agatanushi Hae, while in the 'alternate writing 1-2,' the Empress is Isakahime, who was the daughter of Tochi no agatanonushi Isakahiko.
sen.cmt: 『日本書紀』第1の一書the 'alternate writing 1-1' transmitted by the Nihonshokiとしました。 磯城県主葉江→Shiki no agatanushi Haeとしました。 第2の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 1-2,' transmitted by the Nihonshokiとしました。 十市県主五十坂彦→Tochi no agatanonushi Isakahiko としました。
sen.e: In a first writing in the Nihonshoki, the Empress is called Nagahime, who was a daughter of Shiki no agatanushi Hae, while in a second writing, the Empress is Isakahime, who was a daughter of Tochi no agatanonushi Isakahiko.
sen.cmt: 『日本書紀』第1の一書 --> a first writing in the Nihonshokiと訳出し（他も同様に訳出し）。冠詞の見直し。
sen.e: The first addendum to the Nihonshoki mentions the Empress is Nagahime, who was a daughter of Shiki no agatanushi Hae, while the second addendum describes the Empress as Isakahime, who was a daughter of Tochi no agatanonushi Isakahiko.
sen.cmt: In a first writing in→The first addendum to in a second writing→the second addendum describes

sen.j: 『古事記』の皇后は孝安天皇の姪の忍鹿比売。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the Empress is Oshikahime, who was the niece of Emperor Koan.
In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the Empress is Oshikahime, who was a niece of Emperor Koan.
sen.cmt: nieceの冠詞をtheから aに変更。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), the Empress is Oshikahime, who was a niece of Emperor Koan.
